title: Judge to allow livestream of Georgia election interference case
description: The election interference case against former President Donald Trump and 18 other defendants will be livestreamed on YouTube, the judge in the case says.

title: Drinking borax is a trend on social media, but doctors say it isn't safe
description: Dr. Jennifer Ashton shares what to know about the dangerous health trend.

title: Change in how feds see marijuana could mean big tax cut for pot retailers
description: Biden's proposal to reclassify marijuana could save the cannibis industry billions in federal taxes each year.

title: Judge rules suspect in Ralph Yarl shooting will face trial
description: Andrew Lester, the Missouri man charged in the shooting of teenager Ralph Yarl after he mistakenly went to the wrong house, will face trial, a Clay County judge ruled.

title: Police stop Nebraska man for bucking the law with a bull riding shotgun in his car
description: A car driving with a bull in it was pulled over in northeast Nebraska’s biggest city, but don’t worry, he didn’t steer

title: Student loan interest to resume, inching closer to end of loan payment pause
description: Friday will mark the first significant step toward restarting the student loan process: borrowers will once again see interest accrue on their loan balances.

title: NYC mayor pushes feds to help migrants get work permits
description: Mayor Eric Adams joined other city leaders in calling on an expedited process for migrants to get their work permits.

title: City Council votes to explore legal action against Texas governor over migrant busing
description: The LA City Council is pushing for a probe into Texas Gov. Greg Abbott over his busing of migrants, including whether the city can pursue a lawsuit.

title: McConnell medically cleared by Capitol attending physician after freeze episode
description: Dr. Brian P. Monahan said he spoke with McConnell's neurology team and informed the senator he is medically clear to continue his schedule.

title: FDA sends warning letter to 3 major formula makers over quality control concerns
description: The FDA has just sent new warning letters to three formula companies, red-flagging quality control concerns.

title: WATCH:  Adorable kittens take turns ringing service bell
description: These kittens have mastered the art of getting our attention!

title: A wrong-way crash with a Greyhound bus leaves 1 dead, 18 injured in Maryland
description: Police in Maryland say the driver of an SUV was killed and 18 people were injured in a wrong-way crash with a Greyhound bus

title: WATCH:  Hilarious kid comes up with brilliant name for pet moth and can’t stop laughing
description: We don’t know what’s better, the moth’s name or Mills’ laughing!

title: Hall of Famer Gil Brandt, who helped build Cowboys into 'America's Team,' dies at 91
description: Gil Brandt, overshadowed by coach Tom Landry and general manager Tex Schramm as part of the trio that built the Dallas Cowboys into “America’s Team” in the 1970s, has died

title: Clarence Thomas discloses private flights from Harlan Crow, defends past omissions
description: Justice Clarence Thomas accepted five private jet flights from personal friend and GOP megadonor Harlan Crow last year, according to financial disclosure documents.

title: Trump enters not guilty plea in Georgia election interference case
description: Former President Trump has entered a plea of not guilty in the Georgia election interference case and waived his right to appear at his arraignment.

title: 2 Proud Boy leaders to be sentenced for role in Jan. 6 Capitol attack
description: Two leaders of the Proud Boys convicted of seditious conspiracy are set to be sentenced Thursday for their role in the Jan. 6 attack on the U.S. Capitol.

title: WATCH:  Soldier dressed as mascot surprises son on 1st day of school
description: WELCOME HOME: It was a touching reunion as a soldier disguised as an elementary school’s mascot surprised his son on his first day of second grade.

title: Arrest made in attempted break-in at home of UFC president Dana White
description: Police in Maine say they arrested a 23-year-old on charges of attempting to break into the home of Dana White, the president of Ultimate Fighting Championship

title: Niger's military regime orders police to expel French ambassador
description: A statement from Niger's military regime says the junta has revoked the diplomatic immunity of France’s ambassador and ordered police to expel him from the African country

title: Federal Reserve's preferred inflation gauge shows a modest rise
description: Federal Reserve's preferred inflation gauge shows a modest rise in latest sign of slowing price increases

title: Kia recalls cars to fix trunk latch that won't open from the inside and could trap people
description: Kia is recalling about 320,000 cars in the U.S. to fix a problem that could stop the trunk from being opened from the inside

title: US applications for jobless claims inch back down
description: U.S. applications for unemployment benefits fell slightly last week as businesses continue to retain employees in an economy that has largely withstood rapidly rising interest rates for more than a year

title: North Korea says simulated nuclear attacks on S. Korea, rehearsed occupation of rival
description: North Korea says its latest missile launches were a simulation of “scorched earth” nuclear strikes on South Korea

title: WATCH:  Rare blue supermoon seen in skies across the world
description: A rare 'blue' supermoon appeared in skies around the world Wednesday night.

title: US, Indonesia and 5 other nations hold war drills amid China concerns
description: Soldiers from the U.S., Indonesia and five other nations are participating in a combat exercise on Indonesia’s main island of Java amid concerns about China’s aggression

title: A train slams into group of workers on the tracks at an Italian station, killing 5
description: Italian authorities say a speeding work train slammed into a group of people doing track maintenance work, killing five workers

title: Cause of death revealed for US swim champion Jamie Cail
description: Cail was found unresponsive in February by her boyfriend, police said.

title: 2 men, 4 children hospitalized after Illinois shooting
description: Six people are hospitalized and two are in critical condition after a shooting on the south side of Peoria, Illinois, according to the Peoria Police Department.

title: Charges won't be filed in fatal shooting of college student who went to wrong house
description: No charges will be filed against a homeowner who shot and killed Nicholas Anthony Donofrio, a 20-year-old USC student who accidentally tried to enter his house.

title: Fire kills 15 in Philippine factory, where rains, wrong address delayed firefighters
description: A fire has killed 15 people in a small apparel factory in a Philippine residential area, where flooding, traffic and a wrong address delayed firefighters

title: Over 50 dead in Johannesburg building fire, authorities say
description: More than 50 people were killed in a fire that engulfed a five-story building in central Johannesburg early Thursday, authorities said.

title: Fire kills 15 in Philippine factory
description: A fire has killed 15 people in a small apparel factory in a Philippine residential area, where flooding, traffic and a wrong address delayed firefighters

title: At least 38 people dead in building fire in Johannesburg, South Africa, officials say
description: Emergency services say at least 52 people died in a fire in a multi-story building in Johannesburg, South Africa’s biggest city

title: Marijuana recommendation from Health Dept. hailed by senators as first step to easing restrictions
description: The U.S. Department of Health and Human Services has delivered a recommendation to the Drug Enforcement Administration on marijuana policy, and Senate leaders are hailing it as a first step toward easing federal restrictions on the drug

title: Uvalde mayor calls for district attorney’s resignation, new lawsuit filed
description: Uvalde Mayor Don McLaughlin on Wednesday accused the county’s district attorney of a cover-up in connection with the ongoing investigation into the 2022 school shooting.

title: Memphis plant that uses potentially hazardous chemical will close, company says
description: A medical equipment sterilizing plant using a chemical whose emissions could lead to cause cancer and other health risks says it plans to close its Tennessee location by next spring

title: Nebraska governor signs order narrowly defining sex as that assigned at birth
description: Nebraska's governor has signed an executive order directing state agencies to use narrow definitions of a person's sex

title: Sheriff announces prison transport policy changes following killing of deputy
description: The Marion County sheriff in Indianapolis has announced changes to a prisoner transport policy following the killing of a sheriff’s deputy during an escape attempt

title: Alex Murdaugh loses prison phone privileges after lawyer records phone call for documentary
description: South Carolina prison officials say convicted murderer Alex Murdaugh has lost his phone privileges and his prison tablet computer after his lawyer recorded him reading his journal entries on a call for a documentary on his case

title: WATCH:  Storm surge from Hurricane Idalia washes away home
description: Storm surge caused by Hurricane Idalia washes away a home in Florida's Horseshoe Beach.
